member.name: T:Core.Application
member.summary: Represents a process which contains windows.

member.name: M:Core.Application.Launch(System.String)
member.summary: Runs the process identified by the executable and creates Application object for this executable
member.param: location of the executable

member.name: M:Core.Application.Launch(System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo)
member.summary: Lauches the process and creates and Application object for it

member.name: M:Core.Application.Attach(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an Application object for existing process

member.name: M:Core.Application.Attach(System.Diagnostics.Process)
member.summary: Attaches with existing process

member.name: M:Core.Application.Attach(System.String)
member.summary: Attaches with existing process

member.name: M:Core.Application.AttachOrLaunch(System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo)
member.summary: Attaches to the process if it is running or launches a new process

member.name: M:Core.Application.GetWindow(System.String,Core.Factory.InitializeOption)
member.summary: Get visible window
member.param: Title text of window displayed on desktop
Option which would be used to initialize the window.

member.name: M:Core.Application.GetWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Get visible window
member.param: Title text of window displayed on desktop

member.name: M:Core.Application.GetWindow(Core.UIItems.Finders.SearchCriteria,Core.Factory.InitializeOption)
member.summary: Find the first window which belongs to this application and satisfies the critera.
member.param: found window would be initialized with this option

member.name: M:Core.Application.Kill
member.summary: Kills the applications and waits till it is closed

member.name: M:Core.Application.GetWindows
member.summary: All windows belonging to the application

member.name: M:Core.Application.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Two applications are equal if they have the same process

member.name: M:Core.Application.WaitWhileBusy
member.summary: Waits till application is busy.

member.name: M:Core.Application.Find(System.Predicate{System.String},Core.Factory.InitializeOption)
member.summary: Looks at all the windows visible for the application and finds one which matches the condition. The match is run against the title of the windows
member.param: option for the window which matches the condition

member.name: M:Core.Application.KillAndSaveState
member.summary: Kills the application. Read Application.Kill. It also saves the application test execution state. This saves the position of the window UIItems which would be loaded next time automatically for improved performance. You would need to use InitializedOption.AndIdentifiedBy for specifying the identification of window.

member.name: P:Core.Application.Name
member.summary: Name of the process

member.name: P:Core.Application.ApplicationSession
member.summary: Internal to white

member.name: P:Core.Application.HasExited
member.summary: Returns whether process has exited

member.name: T:Core.AutomationElementSearch.AutomationElementFinder
member.summary: Internal to white and should not be used unless a known issue. One should be able to find all items

member.name: M:Core.AutomationElementSearch.AutomationElementFinder.FindDescendantRaw(Core.AutomationElementSearch.AutomationSearchCondition)
member.summary: Uses the Raw View provided by UIAutomation to find elements. RawView sometimes contains extra AutomationElements. This is internal to white although made public. Should be used only if the standard approaches dont work. Also if you end up using it please raise an issue so that it can be fixed Please understand that calling this method on any UIItem which has a lot of child AutomationElements might result in very bad performance.

member.name: T:Core.C
member.summary: This class is for internal use in white

member.name: T:Core.Configuration.CoreConfiguration
member.summary: Represents all the configuration at Core level. These configuration can be set from the configuration file as well as programmatically.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItem.Error(Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window)
member.summary: Provides the Error on this UIItem. This would return Error object when this item has ErrorProvider displayed next to it.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItem.Click
member.summary: Performs mouse click at the center of this item

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItem.DoubleClick
member.summary: Performs mouse double click at the center of this item

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItem.KeyIn(Core.WindowsAPI.KeyboardInput.SpecialKeys)
member.summary: Perform keyboard action on this UIItem

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItem.UnHookEvents
member.summary: Internal to white and intended to be used for white recording

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItem.HookEvents(Core.Recording.UIItemEventListener)
member.summary: Internal to white and intended to be used for white recording

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItem.GetElement(Core.UIItems.Finders.SearchCriteria)
member.summary: Uses the Raw View provided by UIAutomation to find elements within this UIItem. RawView sometimes contains extra AutomationElements. This is internal to white although made public. Should be used only if the standard approaches dont work. Also if you end up using it please raise an issue so that it can be fixed. Please understand that calling this method on any UIItem which has a lot of child AutomationElements might result in very bad performance.

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.UIItem.AutomationElement
member.summary: Should be used only if white doesn't support the feature you are looking for. Knowledge of UIAutomation would be required. It would better idea to also raise an issue if you are using it.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItemContainer.Get``1
member.summary: Finds UIItem which matches specified type. Useful for non managed applications where controls are not identified by AutomationId, like in Managed applications. In case of multiple items of this type the first one found would be returned which cannot be guaranteed to be the same across multiple invocations.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItemContainer.Get(Core.UIItems.Finders.SearchCriteria)
member.summary: Finds UIItem which matches specified type and searchCriteria. Look at documentation of SearchCriteria for details on it.
member.param: Criteria provided to search UIItem

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.UIItemContainer.ReInitialize(Core.Factory.InitializeOption)
member.summary: Applicable only if CacheMode is used. This is for internal purpose of white and should not be used, as caching by itself is not supported

member.name: T:Core.Factory.InitializeOption
member.summary: In cache mode: The return window contains all primary controls. Is useful when you are going to perform lot of actions on a window. Caching of controls is done only at this call. The cache is not refreshed automatically. In non-cache mode: The controls would be found based on demand.

member.name: M:Core.Factory.InitializeOption.AndIdentifiedBy(System.String)
member.summary: Specify the unique identification for your window. White remembers the location of UIItems inside a window as you find them. Next time when items inside the same window is found they are located first based on position which is faster.

member.name: P:Core.Factory.InitializeOption.WithCache
member.summary: This option should not be used as this is only for internal white purposes

member.name: T:Core.InputDevices.AttachedKeyboard
member.summary: Any operation performed using the keyboard would wait till the window is busy after this operation. Before any operation is performed the window, from which it was retreived, is brought to focus if it is not.

member.name: T:Core.InputDevices.AttachedMouse
member.summary: Any operation performed using the mouse would wait till the window is busy after this operation. Before any operation is performed the window, from which it was retreived, is brought to focus if it is not.

member.name: T:Core.InputDevices.Keyboard
member.summary: Represents Keyboard attachment to the machine.

member.name: F:Core.InputDevices.Keyboard.Instance
member.summary: Use Window.Keyboard method to get handle to the Keyboard. Keyboard instance got using this method would not wait while the application is busy.

member.name: M:Core.InputDevices.Mouse.DragAndDrop(Core.UIItems.IUIItem,Core.UIItems.IUIItem)
member.summary: Drags the dragged item and drops it on the drop item. This can be used for any two UIItems whether they are same application or different. To drop items on desktop use Desktop class's Drop method. Some drag and drop operation need to wait for application to process something while item is being dragged. This can be set but configuring DragStepCount property. This is by default set to 1.

member.name: T:Core.UIItems.ListBoxItems.ListControl
member.summary: ListControl is made of up ListItems and scroll bars.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListBoxItems.ListControl.Select(System.String)
member.summary: Selects list item which matches the text. (For WPF application the lists of objects might require you to provide a ToString override to be selected by text. The standard ToString method returns the objects type so all objects of the same type will look alike.)

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListBoxItems.ListControl.Select(System.Int32)
member.summary: Slects list item by its index

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.ListBoxItems.ListControl.Items
member.summary: Returns all the items belonging to the ListControl

member.name: T:Core.UIItems.DateFormat
member.summary: Format in which the data in entered in the DateTimePicker. e.g. DayMonthYear, DayYearMonth, etc.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.CheckBox.UnSelect
member.summary: Unchecks the checkbox

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.CheckBox.IsSelected
member.summary: true when CheckBox is checked

member.name: T:Core.UIItems.Finders.SearchCriteria
member.summary: SearchCritera can be used when UIItem identification is not satisfied by standard Get methods on UIItemContainer (Window is subclass of UIItemContainer). Multiple criterias can be supplied together based on which the UIItem would be searched. All the conditions would put together as AND condition e.g. SearchCriteria.ByAutomationId("foo").ByControlType(typeof(TextBox)).Indexed(1)

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.Finders.SearchCriteria.ByText(System.String)
member.summary: Create a SearchCriteria with text
member.param: For managed applications this is name given to controls in the application code. For unmanaged applications this is text of the control or label next to it if it doesn't have well defined text.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.Finders.SearchCriteria.Indexed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create criteria with specified index

member.name: T:Core.UIItems.ListView
member.summary: Understands testing ListView in WinForm and WPF. Anything which is of ControlType=DataGrid. In order to test DataGridView in WinForm use Table class. A ListView consists of ListViewHeader and ListViewRows. ListViewHeader contains ListViewColumns. ListViewRows is collection of all the visible rows. A ListViewRow consists of ListViewCells.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListView.Select(System.Int32)
member.summary: Unselects previously selected row and selects this row. If this row is already selected it doesn't have any effect.
member.param: Index of the row to select

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListView.MultiSelect(System.Int32)
member.summary: Unselects previously selected row and selects this row. If this row is already selected it doesn't have any effect.
member.param: Index of the row to select

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListView.Cell(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Find the Cell in the ListView
member.param: headertext of the column

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListView.Select(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Unselects previously selected row and selects this row. If this row is already selected it doesn't have any effect. Row is chosen based on the column name having value specified
member.param: column header text
text of cell

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListView.MultiSelect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Keeps the old row selected and selects this row. If this row is already selected it doesn't have any effect. Row is chosen based on the column name having value specified
member.param: column header text
text of cell

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListView.TryUnSelectAll
member.summary: Try to un select all the rows. This would work when full row select in list view is false and there are atleast two columns

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.ListView.Rows
member.summary: Get all the available rows

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.ListView.Header
member.summary: Get the listview header. This can be used to get column headers.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListViewRow.Select
member.summary: Unselects previously selected row and selects this row. If this row is already selected it doesn't have any effect.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.ListViewRow.MultiSelect
member.summary: Keeps the old row selected and selects this row. If this row is already selected it doesn't have any effect.

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.TextBox.Text
member.summary: Enters the text in the textbox. The text would be cleared first. This is not as good performing as the BulkText method. This does raise all keyboard events.

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.TextBox.BulkText
member.summary: Sets the text in the textbox. The text would be cleared first. This is a better performing than the Text method. This doesn't raise all keyboard events.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.PopupMenu(System.String[])
member.summary: This should be used after RightClick on a UIItem (which can be window as well).
member.param: Path to the menu which need to be retrieved. e.g. "Root" is one of the menus in the first level, "Level1" is inside "Root" menu and "Level2" is inside "Level1". So on. "Root", etc are text of the menu visible to user.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.ModalWindow(System.String,Core.Factory.InitializeOption)
member.summary: Get the modal window launched by this window.
member.param: Title of the modal window
Newly created window would be initialized using this option

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.ModalWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Get the modal window launched by this window and it uses InitializeOption as NoCache
member.param: Title of the modal window

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.MessageBox(System.String)
member.summary: Get the MessageBox window launched by this window
member.param: Title of the messagebox

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.ItemsWithin(Core.UIItems.UIItem)
member.summary: Find all the UIItems which belongs to a window and are within (bounds of) another UIItem.
member.param: Containing item

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.MdiChild(Core.UIItems.Finders.SearchCriteria)
member.summary: Returns a UIItemContainer using which other sub-ui items can be retrieved. Since there is no single standard identification for MdiChild windows, hence it is has been left open for user.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.ModalWindows
member.summary: Recursively gets all the descendant windows.

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.Keyboard
member.summary: Returns a keyboard which is associated to this window. Any operation performed using the mouse would wait till the window is busy after this operation. Before any operation is performed the window is brought to focus.

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.WindowItems.Window.Mouse
member.summary: Returns a mouse which is associated to this window. Any operation performed using the mouse would wait till the window is busy after this operation. Before any operation is performed the window is brought to focus.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TableItems.TableRows.GetMultipleRows(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns multiple rows containing the value for specified column.

member.name: T:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.Tree
member.summary: Tree consists of TreeNodes. TreeNodes is a collection of TreeNode. Each TreeNode in turn consists of TreeNodes.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.Tree.HasNode(System.String[])
member.summary: Checks the presence on the TreeNode. If multi-level find is specified in arguments then in process of finding the TreeNode it would also expand the TreeNodes.
member.param: e.g. when arguments are ("Parent", "Child", "GrandChild") it would return the TreeNode "GrandChild" which is under "Child", which in turn is under "Parent", root node. To get the "Parent" node one needs to just specify ("Parent") as argument.
member.returns: true if it finds such node, false otherwise

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.Tree.Node(System.String[])
member.summary: Gets the TreeNode. If multi-level find is specified in arguments then in process of finding the TreeNode it would also expand the TreeNodes.
member.param: e.g. when arguments are ("Parent", "Child", "GrandChild") it would return the TreeNode "GrandChild" which is under "Child", which in turn is under "Parent", root node. To get the "Parent" node one needs to just specify ("Parent") as argument.
member.returns: TreeNode object when found, null if otherwise

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.Tree.GetPathTo(Core.UIItems.TreeItems.TreeNode)
member.summary: Finds path to the TreeNode. It doesn't expand the nodes to find it.

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.Tree.EditableNodeText
member.summary: Editable TreeNode's value can be set using this.

member.name: P:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.Tree.Nodes
member.summary: List of all root nodes

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.TreeNode.GetItem(System.String[])
member.summary: Gets the TreeNode matching the path. If multi-level find is specified in arguments then in process of finding the TreeNode it would also expand the TreeNodes.
member.param: e.g. when arguments are ("Parent", "Child", "GrandChild") it would return the TreeNode "GrandChild" which is under "Child", which in turn is under "Parent", root node. To get the "Parent" node one needs to just specify ("Parent") as argument.
member.returns: TreeNode object when found, null if otherwise

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.TreeNode.Select
member.summary: Selects the TreeNode by clicking on it

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.TreeNode.Expand
member.summary: Expands the node by double clicking on the node in case of Non WPF applications. This might lead to some inconsistent behaviour. For WPF it performs only expand with no side effect.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.TreeNode.Collapse
member.summary: Collapses the node by double clicking on the node in case of Non-WPF applications. This might lead to some inconsistent behaviour. For WPF it performs only collapose and side effects.

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.TreeNode.Click
member.summary: Same as Select

member.name: M:Core.UIItems.TreeItems.TreeNodes.GetItem(System.String[])
member.summary: Gets the TreeNode matching the path. If multi-level find is specified in arguments then in process of finding the TreeNode it would also expand the TreeNodes.
member.param: e.g. when arguments are ("Parent", "Child", "GrandChild") it would return the TreeNode "GrandChild" which is under "Child", which in turn is under "Parent", root node. To get the "Parent" node one needs to just specify ("Parent") as argument.
member.returns: true if it finds such node, false otherwise
